Body: I've run across the specifications for this Android device, the HTC One V. On the PhoneArena site, the specs have it that the phone has both a proximity sensor and a light sensor. I thought a proximity sensor uses light to detect proximity. What is the difference between these two?
Title: What is the difference between a proximity sensor and a light sensor?

history.Text: I've run across the specifications for [this android device, the HTC One V](http://www.phonearena.com/phones/HTC-One-V_id6850). On the PhoneArena site, the specs have it that the phone has both a proximity sensor and a light sensor. I thought a proximity sensor uses light to detect proximity.What is the difference between these two? Thanks.
What is the difference between a proximity sensor and a light sensor?

I've run across the specifications for [this Android device, the HTC One V](http://www.phonearena.com/phones/HTC-One-V_id6850). On the PhoneArena site, the specs have it that the phone has both a proximity sensor and a light sensor. I thought a proximity sensor uses light to detect proximity. What is the difference between these two?
